page.title: 05Transport In Poringland
page.content: Road is the only way to Poringland.The B1332 is the main road.Its very busy and dangerous.In recent years 3 have died and 4 seriously injured.There is a good bus service to Norwich.There are 4 garages with petrol priced at Â£2.05 per gallon.Even with so many local cars trade is poor no coaches or cars are hired but 2 driving schools are based here.Even though Framingham Earl has a Railway Tavern, no railway has ever been there do to Colmans of Norwich not selling the land needed. COMMUNICATION: The radio masts are mostly situated in Upper Stoke. There are 3 masts 1 is owned by the ministry of defence.The 2nd is owned by British Telecom.The 3rd mast is to be taken down.The area has 2 Post Offices used by the local people in the village.
